intro: Bradburya lobata, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Bradburya lobata has a low, sprawling growth habit with succulent stems and leaves that are adapted to conserve water. It produces small, green fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals and wind.
